meanings.definition: To give life or energy to
meanings.sent1: I try to vitalize my plants by giving them plenty of sunlight and water.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can vitalize your body and make you feel more energetic.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy town came alive after the circus arrived to vitalize it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to vitalize the room, filling it with joy and energy.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air and sunshine seemed to vitalize the old man, making him feel young again.

meanings.definition: To make something more lively or active
meanings.sent1: Adding some colorful decorations can vitalize a dull room and make it more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: Music has the power to vitalize a party and get people dancing.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to vitalize the traditional recipe by adding a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm seemed to vitalize the team, motivating them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: A fresh coat of paint can vitalize an old piece of furniture, giving it new life.
